com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp

Class MvpFragment<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.MvpFragment<V,P>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V,P>, MvpView
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MvpLceFragment, MvpViewStateFragment

    public abstract class MvpFragment<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
extends Fragment
implements BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V,P>, MvpView
    A Fragment that uses an MvpPresenter to implement a Model-View-Presenter architecture
    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Method Detail

      • createPresenter

        public abstract P createPresenter()
        Creates a new presenter instance, if needed. Will reuse the previous presenter instance if BaseMvpDelegateCallback.setRetainInstance(boolean) is set to true. This method will be called from onViewCreated(View, Bundle)
        Specified by:
        createPresenter in interface BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        the created presenter instance

      • getMvpDelegate

        protected FragmentMvpDelegate<V,P> getMvpDelegate()
        * Get the mvp delegate. This is internally used for creating presenter, attaching and detaching view from presenter.

        Please note that only one instance of mvp delegate should be used per fragment instance.

        Only override this method if you really know what you are doing.

        Returns:
        FragmentMvpDelegateImpl

      • getPresenter

        public P getPresenter()
        Description copied from interface: BaseMvpDelegateCallback
        Get the presenter. If null is returned, then a internally a new presenter instance gets created by calling BaseMvpDelegateCallback.createPresenter()
        Specified by:
        getPresenter in interface BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        the presenter instance. can be null.

      • setPresenter

      • isRetainInstance

        public boolean isRetainInstance()
        Description copied from interface: BaseMvpDelegateCallback
        Indicate whether the retain instance feature is enabled by this view or not
        Specified by:
        isRetainInstance in interface BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        true if the view has enabled retaining, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        BaseMvpDelegateCallback.setRetainInstance(boolean)

      • shouldInstanceBeRetained

        public boolean shouldInstanceBeRetained()
        Description copied from interface: BaseMvpDelegateCallback
        Indicates whether or not the the view will be retained during next screen orientation change. This boolean flag is used for MvpPresenter.detachView(boolean) as parameter. Usually you should take Activity#isChangingConfigurations() into account. The difference between BaseMvpDelegateCallback.shouldInstanceBeRetained() and BaseMvpDelegateCallback.isRetainInstance() is that BaseMvpDelegateCallback.isRetainInstance() indicates that retain instance feature is enabled or disabled while BaseMvpDelegateCallback.shouldInstanceBeRetained() indicates if the view is going to be destroyed permanently and hence should no more be retained (i.e. Activity is finishing and not just screen orientation changing)
        Specified by:
        shouldInstanceBeRetained in interface BaseMvpDelegateCallback<V extends MvpView,P extends MvpPresenter<V>>
        Returns:
        true if the instance should be retained, otherwise false
